data.title: Gamesmith : Game Development Competition
data.details:
About the Event:  

GameSmith is a unique Gamathon inviting Indian entrepreneurs, startups, industry experts, and students to unleash their creativity and craft innovative games across a variety of genres. From adventure-packed quests to educational platforms, this is your chance to design the next big thing in gaming while addressing themes relevant to MyGov.  

Team Size: 2-4 members  

Genres of Games:  

  • Adventure Games  
  • Real-Time Strategy (RTS)  
  • Board Games  
  • Puzzle Games  
  • Role Playing Games (RPG)  
  • Educational Games  
  • Open Theme  

Game Design Engines:  

  • Contestants may use any free/open-source platforms like Scratch, GODOT, Unity, Cocos2d, or others to develop their games.  

Evaluation Process:  

The Gamathon will follow a structured three-stage selection process:  

Round 1: Registration and Idea Submission  

  • Teams must register and submit a presentation (4-10 slides) outlining their game idea.  
  • Evaluation Criteria:  
    1. Overall idea  
    2. Number of players in the game  
    3. Uniqueness of the concept  

Deadline: January 13, 2026 (Online)

Round 2: Submission Round  

Teams shortlisted from Round 1 must submit:  

  • Overview of the game and design/development process with screenshots/images.  
  • The game’s alignment with MyGov themes.  
  • A 4-5 slide presentation detailing:  
  • A 4-minute gameplay video showcasing interaction and gameplay.  

Event Date: January 24, 2025 (Offline)  

Round 3: Jury Round  

Selected teams will:  

  • Demonstrate their game to the Jury.  
  • Submit an executable version of the game playable on a web browser.  
  • Provide source code and libraries.  
  • Participate in a Q&A session with Jury members.  

Event Date: January 23, 2026 (Offline)  

Evaluation Criteria:  

  • Gameplay (10 Marks): Smoothness, balance, and meaningful player choices.  
  • Originality (15 Marks): Innovation and uniqueness of the design.  
  • Use of Theme (25 Marks): Relevance and clarity of MyGov themes.  
  • Overall WOW Factor (30 Marks): Engagement, fun, and shareability. 

Bring your creativity, strategy, and passion for gaming to CodeCraft and compete to create the ultimate gaming experience!

data.title: Neural Wars
data.details:
This event challenges participants to design an autonomous decision-making agent that competes in a controlled environment.
Participants will receive a code template containing the required function signatures. They must implement the logic of their agent strictly within this template and submit a single Python file as their entry.

General Rules:

  • Participants must use the official template provided.
  • All logic must reside inside one Python (.py) file.
  • No additional files, libraries, or external dependencies will be accepted.
  • Only basic algorithmic techniques are permitted. Reinforcement learning or any learning-based methods are strictly prohibited.
  • Any attempt to manipulate, exploit, or bypass the evaluation mechanism (including hacking, exploiting loopholes, manipulating score outputs, hard-coding predictions, or reverse-engineering the backend) will result in immediate disqualification.
  • The agent must operate purely from the information passed to it through the provided function calls.
  • The event is competitive. Performance is determined solely by backend evaluation under identical conditions for all participants.
  • Submission : Online
  • Once the problem statement is released, the subission must be done within the next 12 hours.



  • As part of our ongoing collaboration with Devdock.AI, every participant is required to complete the registration process by following the steps provided in the document. This will help us streamline technical access, ensure authentication, and enable smooth coordination for upcoming activities. (Also this is an important criteria for participating and only participants who have successfully completed the Devdock registration and have been verified will be eligible to apply for the hackathon.)

    What you need to do (In detail instructions provided in the doc):
    1️⃣ Download the Devdock extension
    2️⃣ Sign up using your GitHub account
    3️⃣ Follow the instructions in the this PDF 
    4️⃣ Upload your screenshot in the Google Form

    Google Form

    Your quick response is important — please complete the process at the earliest!
    If you face any issues, feel free to reach out. Let’s get this done together!

    If you have any doubts contact:
    8269928840
    Atharva Waghmare

data.title: East India Blockchain Summit(EIBS) 2.0
data.details:
Event Overview

The East India Blockchain Summit (EIBS) 2.0 is a flagship hackathon and innovation challenge curated by the Kharagpur Blockchain Society, bringing together some of the brightest student innovators from across disciplines.

This high-impact platform enables participants to ideate, design, and scale solutions in the rapidly evolving blockchain and Web3 ecosystem. Teams will work on real-world problem statements, blending technical depth with creative thinking to push the boundaries of decentralized innovation.

Beyond the competitive aspect, EIBS 2.0 offers direct exposure to industry leaders, mentors, and founders, along with hands-on learning and high-value networking.

Get the opportunity to witness keynotes and workshops from top industry leaders, and network with the brightest of minds in the Web3 space

Top-performing teams will compete for a substantial prize pool, incubation and mentorship opportunities, and exclusive rewards, positioning EIBS 2.0 as a true launchpad for the next generation of blockchain builders.

Eligibility & Participation Guidelines

  • Open to undergraduate and postgraduate students (full-time or part-time) from any discipline, enrolled in any recognized Indian college or institution.
  • Participants may register in teams of 2-4 members
  • Cross-discipline and cross-college teams are allowed, promoting diverse collaboration.
  • Each participant can be part of only one team throughout the event.
  • All team members must individually verify and confirm their details for the team to be considered valid.
  • Any violation of these guidelines will result in immediate disqualification of the entire team.

Student Verification & Documentation

  • Participants must be currently enrolled in a recognized degree or diploma program (full-time or part-time) in India.
  • Valid proof of enrollment, age, and address must be submitted upon request by East India Blockchain Summit 2025 for eligibility verification.
  • Failure to provide the required documents may lead to disqualification.

Submission Format (Important)

  • The initial submission round is PPT-only.
  • Working prototype or project submission is optional at the PPT Submission Round.
  • Shortlisted teams advancing to the Grand Finale must present a working prototype during the Final Round.

data.title: CodeWarz
data.details:
CodeWarz is a structured competitive programming event designed to evaluate participants' proficiency in coding, algorithms, and problem-solving. The competition features multiple rounds that test theoretical knowledge, analytical capability, coding accuracy, and response speed.

Event Overview:

  • Participants compete in teams of two and progress through a preliminary screening followed by an intensive multi-round main event. Each stage is designed to assess different dimensions of technical competence.

Round Structure:

Preliminary Round:

  • An MCQ-based assessment covering Programming Fundamentals and Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).
  • Top-scoring teams will qualify for the Main Rounds.

Main Rounds:

The main event consists of four sub-rounds:

Coding Round:

  • Five programming problems of varying difficulty levels (Easy, Medium, Hard).
  • Evaluation focuses on logic, efficiency, and correctness.

Fill the Algorithm:

  • Teams analyze and correct incomplete algorithms.
  • Tests understanding of algorithmic flow and optimization.

Rapid Fire:

  • A quick-response technical round aimed at testing fundamental knowledge and presence of mind.

ReelsRiddle:

  • A visual interpretation round where participants identify programming concepts based on short video clips.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Correctness of solutions and number of problems solved
  • Time taken to arrive at the solution
  • Quality of logic and optimisation (time & space)
  • Debugging skills and ability to handle edge cases
  • Team coordination and strategy

Rules & Guidelines:

  • Each team must consist of exactly two members.
  • Only the permitted languages and compilers in the lab may be used.
  • Internet access and external code templates are strictly not allowed.
  • Use of AI coding assistants is not permitted unless explicitly allowed by organisers.
  • Any malpractice will result in immediate disqualification.
  • Organisers and judges reserve the right to modify problems or scoring if required.

data.title: DataQuest 2026
data.details:
All That You Need to Know About DataQuest 2026

Step into the future, data warriors! Megalith 2026, IIT Kharagpur presents DataQuest 2026, an online data science and AI hackathon that challenges participants to design and build intelligent systems capable of reasoning over information and generating meaningful outputs.

DataQuest 2026 focuses on applied AI, system design, and problem-solving using modern machine learning approaches.

 

Overview

Calling all data analysts, AI enthusiasts, and machine learning practitioners!

DataQuest 2026 invites you to work on a real-world inspired AI challenge centered around building a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline. Participants are expected to design an end-to-end solution that can retrieve relevant information efficiently and generate accurate, context-aware responses.

 

Problem Statement

The problem statement has been attached on the platform.

Participants are required to carefully review the attached problem statement, understand the use case, and start working on their RAG-based solution immediately after registration.

 

Team Formation

  • Team size: 1 to 5 members

  • Solo participation is allowed

  • Inter-college and inter-specialization teams are permitted

Collaboration is encouraged to bring diverse technical strengths together.

 

Eligibility

  • Open to all graduating students

  • Students from any discipline or specialization may participate

  • No restriction on academic background

 

Prizes & Rewards

Prize Pool: Up to ₹50,000
StockEdge Vouchers for winners to support analytics and AI education
Certificates for top-performing teams

Detailed prize distribution will be announced on the platform.

 

Mandatory Registration Requirement

As part of the registration process, all team members must star the following GitHub repositories:

  • https://github.com/pathwaycom/llm-app

  • https://github.com/pathwaycom/pathway

️Only teams that complete this requirement during registration will be eligible to proceed further in the competition.
Proof submission is mandatory and will be verified.

(This requirement is also reflected in the registration form for transparency.)

 

Register now, review the problem statement, and start building your RAG-based solution.
Let intelligence meet implementation.

prizes.others: Cash prizes worth up to ₹50,000 will be awarded to top-performing teams based on overall evaluation.
StockEdge vouchers will be awarded to selected top-performing teams to support analytics and financial education.
All eligible participants who complete the hackathon will receive a participation certificate from Megalith 2026, IIT Kharagpur.

data.title: IEEE Mega Project 8.O
data.details:
Overview:

IEEE Mega Project 8.0 is a flagship project-based competition designed to encourage innovation, problem-solving, and real-world application of technology. Participants will conceptualize and build a working solution and get the opportunity to present their work before experienced professionals from leading tech organizations. Exciting rewards, recognition, and valuable industry exposure await the best teams.

Who Can Participate?

  • Open to undergraduate and postgraduate students from all branches and disciplines
  • Participation is team-based
  • Each team must consist of 2–3 members

Competition Flow:

Phase 1: Project Building & Submission

Teams must design and implement a fully working project based on an original idea.

Submissions must include (before the deadline):

  • GitHub repository link containing complete source code
  • Live deployed project link (working demo)

️ Note: A PPT is not required in Phase 1.

Submissions will be evaluated on originality, practicality, and technical soundness.

Phase 2: Final Presentation Round:

Selected teams will be invited to deliver a live project demonstration and presentation.

Teams must present a Project PPT covering:

  • Problem identification and proposed solution
  • Tools, frameworks, and technologies used
  • System design and implementation strategy
  • Obstacles faced and how they were resolved
  • Scope, impact, and future enhancement possibilities

A panel comprising industry professionals and domain experts will judge the teams based on:

  • Depth of technical implementation
  • Creativity and uniqueness of the idea
  • Real-world relevance and usefulness
  • Communication and presentation effectiveness

Guidelines & Regulations:

  • All projects must be new and independently developed specifically for IEEE Mega Project 8.0
  • Any form of plagiarism or reuse of existing templates/projects will lead to immediate disqualification
  • Teams must strictly follow all submission timelines
  • Decisions made by the evaluation panel will be final and non-negotiable

Evaluation Parameters:

  • Innovation & Originality – Freshness of the idea
  • Technical Strength – Design complexity and execution quality
  • Practical Impact – Applicability to real-world problems
  • Scalability – Potential for expansion and long-term use
  • Presentation & Defense – Explanation clarity and response to questions

Important Dates:

  • Registration Closes: 24 December 2025
  • Phase 1 Submission Deadline: 24 January 2026
  • Final Presentation Round: Schedule to be announced

Awards & Recognition:

  • Top Teams: Cash prizes worth up to ₹25,000 along with Certificates of Achievement
  • All Participants: Official Participation Certificates

Important: Official Communication Channel:

To ensure that you do not miss any important updates, announcements, instructions, or deadline changes, it is mandatory for all participants to join the official IEEE Mega Project 8.0 information group.

All future communication related to the event will be shared exclusively through this group.

WhatsApp Info Group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/ICeN2GZLaOBFokdiLuF5pU

data.title: Logic League
data.details:
Step into the Logic League, where every Sunday challenges you to think sharper, code faster, and level up your problem-solving game!
Take on 5 coding questions spanning multiple difficulty levels — crafted to simulate real-world interview rounds and industry-grade assessments used by top tech companies.

If you’re ready to test your logic, this is your arena to shine.

Why Participate:

  • Compete with some of the best coders in a fair and proctored test environment
  • Solve questions covering Data Structures, Algorithms, and Interview Prep topics
  • Experience the pressure and precision of real hiring challenges
  • Strengthen your coding strategy, speed, and analytical thinking
  • Earn ranks, certificates, and recognition for your skills

Join our WhatsApp community – Logic League – to stay updated with contests and coding discussions!

Marking Scheme:

The assessment includes 5 coding questions:

  • 1 Hard Question – 30 marks
  • 2 Intermediate Questions – 20 marks each
  • 2 Easy Questions – 15 marks each

Total Marks: 100
Duration: 2 Hours
Negative Marking: None

Full marks only for solutions that pass all test cases.
No marks for partial or sample-only outputs.

Competition Guidelines:

  • The contest runs in full-screen mode. Switching tabs or background activity may lead to disqualification.
  • Once you start, you must complete the test in one sitting. No pauses or retakes allowed.
  • Only the first submission for each question will be considered — no resubmissions.
  • Use of AI tools, copied code, or external assistance is strictly prohibited. Any plagiarism results in disqualification.
  • Ensure a stable internet connection and avoid refreshing or closing the test window mid-assessment.

Ready to Prove Your Logic?

Gear up, code smart, and rise through the ranks.
Power up your Sunday with the Logic League on Unstop!

data.title: Code at Christmas Powered by Lovable
data.details:
This Christmas, we’re not solving world problems.
We’re building weird, useless, funny, and cozy projects, just for the joy of it.

Code At Christmas is a 4-hour virtual vibe coding hackathon exclusively for girls, where creativity matters more than perfection and fun matters more than feasibility. No pressure. No judges. No mentors. Just vibes, AI tools, laughter, and the freedom to build anything your imagination wants.

If you’ve ever wanted to build that ridiculous idea you never took seriously, this is your sign.

Join Whatsapp Group for all updates: https://chat.whatsapp.com/B8k1rFRIlglKacwizdfUt8

Who Can Join?

  • Girls only.
  • Solo participation

What Will You Build?

  • The most weird
  • The most useless
  • The most fun project you can imagine
  • Built using vibe coding only
  • All AI tools are allowed

Your project must be live-hosted on GitHub and contributed to the GLT repository.

Event Details:

  • Date: 24 December 2025
  • Time: 12:00 Noon – 4:00 PM IST
  • Duration: 4 Hours
  • Mode: Virtual
  • Live Stream: Girls Leading Tech LinkedIn

What’s in It for You?

Winners Get:

  • Canva Pro Subscription (1 year) worth ₹4,000
  • Featured on LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, Newsletter & Community
  • A podcast episode on our official channel
  • Winner certificate

Every Participant Gets:

  • Participation certificate
  • Featured on the website with their project
  • Feedback from fellow hackers
  • A memorable Christmas coding experience

Cozy Things Happening Alongside Hacking

While you code, we’ll keep things fun and warm:

  • Hourly quizzes
  • Live podcast station
  • Continuous mini-games in the hackathon server
  • Christmas networking rooms (matched by interests, with a moderator)
  • A virtual feedback wall to share thoughts, memes, and feels

The Fun Part: Live Pitch & Roast

After the hackathon:

  • Each hacker/team gets 5 minutes to pitch their project
  • Pitch theme: Why this project is absolutely useless (and why you love it)
  • Our team will playfully roast your idea, all in good fun

How Are Winners Chosen?

  • No judges
  • No mentors
  • Winners are selected through community voting on LinkedIn

Top 10 Selection Criteria For Voting Round:

  • Most weird project
  • Most useless project
  • Creativity in vibe coding
  • Pitch delivery
  • Live GitHub-hosted project (GLT repo contribution)

Why Code At Christmas?

Because not everything has to be impactful, scalable, or revolutionary.

Sometimes, coding is about:

  • Laughing at your own ideas
  • Building without fear
  • Creating something just because it feels right

Code At Christmas is your safe, cozy space to experiment, vibe, and celebrate coding as play.

data.title: KU Hackathon 2026
data.details:
About the Event

Kalinga University, Raipur, is hosting KU Hackathon 2026, a 24-hour national-level innovation sprint organized by the Department of Computer Science & Faculty of Information Technology. The hackathon invites students and young professionals across India to code, create, and contribute towards solving real-world challenges.

Theme: “Code. Create. Contribute: Solving Real-World Problems through Technology”

Participants will ideate, prototype, and pitch their solutions in interdisciplinary teams, guided by expert mentors and evaluated by a distinguished panel of judges.

Participants can choose one domain to work on:

  • FinTech – Secure, inclusive, and efficient digital finance solutions.
  • Gaming & Gamification – Games and gamification for learning, health, or social impact.
  • Cybersecurity – Tools & systems to protect data, devices, and networks.
  • Waste Management – Smart, tech-driven solutions for sustainability.

Prizes (Total worth 77,500/- INR )

  • 1st Prize: ₹25,000
  • 2nd Prize: ₹15,000
  • 3rd Prize: ₹10,000
  • 4th Prize: ₹7,500
  • Consolation Prizes: ₹5,000 each (Total 20,000)

Eligibility & Team Size

  • Open to all university students & young professionals across India.
  • Team Size: Maximum 2 members (+1 optional mentor).

Registration Details

  • Registration Fee: ₹200/- per team (initial submission)
  • Final Round Fee: ₹2,000/- per team (includes food & accommodation)
  • Mentor Fee (optional): ₹1,000/- (includes food & accommodation)

Important Dates:

How to Register

data.title: EnCode 2026: Code To Innovate
data.details:
Are you a curious mind eager to harness the latest advancements in AI to transform the world? Or do you have the vision to invent solutions for the future? So, what are you waiting for? Register now and leave your mark in the world of AI with EnCode 2026!

data.details:

data.title: Marketwise
data.details:
Event Overview:

MarketWise is a machine learning and data science hackathon, which will be held on Unstop for round 1 and offline on Kaggle for round 2. The contest will be like any other Machine learning and data science hackathon that takes place on various platforms. It is designed to ignite creative and productive thinking that revolves around harnessing the potential of machine learning and data science.

Eligibility Criteria & Team Formulation:

  • Open to all from any discipline in any college based out of India.
  • Participants can register individually or in teams with at most 4 members.
  • Cross-specialization and cross-college teams are allowed.
  • All the team members are required to verify and confirm their details to form a team.
  • A student can be a part of only one team.
  • Any deviation from the above-mentioned guidelines will result in the immediate disqualification of the entire team.
  • The Participant(s) should be an Indian citizen, residing in India only and above 18 years of age on the date of the participation.
  • The Participant(s) should be students currently enrolled in a degree/diploma course (part-time or full-time) from any discipline in any college based out of India.
  • The Participant should not have a criminal conviction or an arrangement or a contract that prevents the Participant from participating in the Competition.

Competition Structure:

Round 1 - Online Quiz:

  • The online round is a quiz format, and participants will be tested on their knowledge of basic programming concepts and their awareness of current technology trends.
  • Questions will cover a wide range of topics related to data science and machine learning.
  • Participants will have a limited time to answer each question, and their scores will be recorded.
  • The top performers in the online round will qualify for the offline round at the IIITN Campus.
  • Only one member from each team will be allowed to participate in the quiz.

Round 2- Offline Round at IIITN Campus:

  • The offline round is a 24-hour coding competition held at the IIITN Campus.
  • Participants will be given a dataset to solve a corporate-life-related problem statement.
  • Participants can choose their preferred programming languages and are allowed to use AI models of their choice.
  • The competition will commence at a specified time and conclude 24 hours later.
  • Participants must submit their solutions within the allotted time.

Two ways to participate:

  • Participate in Event:
    • Register and participate in the online quiz on 6th Jan 2026.
    • Selected participants will compete for the prize on 16th & 17th Jan during E-Summit’26.
  • Attend as an Observer:
    • Even if you're not participating, you can attend the event as an observer.
    • Witness the excitement, learn from others, and network with fellow students.

General Rules:

  • Event Oversight: The conducting team is the primary authority responsible for managing and addressing any issues during the event.
  • Enforcement of Rules: The conducting team has the authority to enforce event rules and maintain decorum. Rule breaches may result in appropriate action.
  • Reporting Problems: Participants can communicate concerns or issues to the management team via designated representatives at the venue.
  • Event Supervision: A dedicated team will oversee all activities and proceedings.
  • Originality of Ideas: Plagiarism or use of pre-existing business plans may result in disqualification.
  • Ultimate Authority: All decisions, including selecting winners or providing feedback, are solely at the discretion of the esteemed panel of judges.

data.title: Beach Hack Season 7
data.details:
About Beach Hack Season 7:

BeachHack is the flagship event of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, a legacy event hosted by the Community Of Developers (CODe) from Christ College of Engineering, Irinjalakuda.

It is a national-level hackathon that dares to be different-held not in classrooms or auditoriums, but at a beach resort right beside the shoreline, where creativity flows as freely as the waves.

Returning for another season of innovation, BeachHack 7 invites developers, designers, and entrepreneurs to collaborate, create, and conquer under the open sky. This isn’t just a coding competition; it’s a 36-hour celebration of technology, creativity, and community spirit.

This year, we are thrilled to present the 7th edition of Beach Hack, proudly celebrated as India’s one and only beachside hackathon.

We offer a prize pool of ₹1.5 lakhs, with two competitive tracks:

  • Beach Hack – for participants from other colleges (₹1,00,000 prize pool)
  • Hack4Christ – exclusively for students of Christ College of Engineering (₹50,000 prize pool)

Why BeachHack?

  • The Only Beach Hackathon: Experience the unique thrill of debugging with a sea breeze.
  • Legacy of Excellence: Organized by the face of the CSE Department at CCE, adhering to a tradition of quality and student-centric events.
  • Networking & Mentorship: Connect with industry experts, like-minded peers, and tech leaders in an informal, high-energy setting.
  • 150K+ Prize Pool: Compete for substantial cash prizes and exclusive swag.
  • Zero Registration Fee: Innovation should have no barriers. Admission is completely free.

Format:

  • Team Size: 4 Members
  • Duration: 36 Hours
  • Selection: Abstract-based shortlisting

Tracks: 

  1. AI Pipelines & MLOps Orchestration
    The track focuses on the engineering layer behind AI - pipelines, automation, monitoring, reliability, and optimization. Participants are expected to deliver solutions that enhance the scalability, trustworthiness, and operational robustness of modern AI systems.
  2. Web3 Infrastructure & On-Chain Forensics
    A deep dive into the structural and analytical components of blockchain ecosystems. This track emphasizes transparency, secure infrastructure development, cross-chain operability, and identity management in decentralized systems.
  3. Cloud-Native & DevOps Intelligence
    Here we look for innovations that elevate cloud efficiency and system intelligence. From infrastructure observability to automated optimization, the focus is on systems that improve performance, reduce overhead, and strengthen cloud-native workflows.
  4. Cybersecurity & Threat Intelligence
    The track expects participants to push the boundaries of digital security. Emphasis is on identifying vulnerabilities, strengthening security posture, analyzing threat patterns, and building systems capable of proactive protection.
  5. Algorithmic FinTech & RegTech
    Centered around the data and compliance backbone of financial technology. Participants will work on intelligent systems that enhance regulatory accuracy, financial transparency, risk assessment, and backend financial automation.
  6. Defense Tech & Situational Awareness
    Participants explore technologies that improve monitoring, decision-making, and secure communication in defense contexts. The focus is on awareness, precision, and reliability in mission-critical environments.
  7. Industrial IoT & Predictive Maintenance
    The track spotlights innovations in connected industrial environments. You are expected to engineer systems that enhance operational intelligence, minimize downtime, and refine the interaction between machines, sensors, and data.
  8. Health Data Systems & Bio-Informatics
    The focus here is responsible handling of complex medical data, intelligent diagnostic workflows, and secure bio-information processing. Participants are expected to elevate healthcare systems through accuracy, security, and computational insight.

Beach Hack isn’t just an event.
It’s a movement of ideas, collaboration, passion, and engineering excellence.

Learn more: https://www.beachhack.in/

data.title: Appian AI Application Challenge 2026
data.details:
Appian is a software company that automates business processes. The Appian AI Process Platform includes everything you need to design, automate and optimize even the most complex processes from start to finish. The world's most innovative organizations trust Appian to improve their workflows, unify data and optimize operations-resulting in better growth and superior customer experiences.

Stages:

  • Round - 1: Brand awareness quiz. Mandatory for all participants to give this quiz.
  • Round - 2: Online PPT submission round (15th December 2025 - 26th December 2025)
  • Final Round: Shortlisted teams should present their work to judges in IIT Madras

 

Guidelines:

  • You have to select any one of the listed two problem statements and solve it.
  • This event is open to all.
  • A student cannot be part of more than one team.
  • Each team can submit only one entry for the competition.
  • The problem statement(Attached below) will be released on 15th of December.

Submission format:

  • Submitting the ppt is mandatory (this will be presented by you to judges in the finals round)
  • The first slide of the ppt should also contain the link to the GitHub repository where you have to upload your code. Ensure you have given view access to everyone.
  • Keep the PPT simple and logical.
    Start by explaining the problem in your own words, then clearly say what you’re trying to solve. Walk us through your idea at a high level—what data comes in, what your system does, and what comes out. Explain the main intuition behind your approach and how it would actually work in practice. Add one concrete example to show a real scenario. Mention any assumptions you’re making and what you’re not covering. End with the impact and why this would help in the real world.
  • The code should contain the model and a basic working UI.
  • Note: Code is preferable but not mandatory.

Rules:

  • This is a team competition consisting of one to four members.
  • The first round will be the submission round, where the team needs to submit their submission through Unstop (online) before the deadline mentioned above.
  • The decision of the organizers and judges will be final and binding on the team.

prizes.others: Participation Certificates for all members of the teams that submit PPT via Unstop

data.title: CodeCrafter by IgniteX 2.0
data.details:
CodeCrafter is an individual problem-solving and programming event where participants attempt timed coding challenges designed to assess logical thinking, algorithm familiarity, critical reasoning, and efficiency in implementation.

Guidelines:

Eligibility:

  • Open to all engineering undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Students from any specialization (CSE, IT, ECE, EE, ME, CE, etc.) can participate.
  • Individual participation only (no teams).
  • Participants must be enrolled in a recognized engineering educational institution.

Format:

Single Round – Offline Coding Challenge:

  • Participants will attempt coding problems individually.
  • The round will be conducted offline at IMI Kolkata campus.
  • The challenge will be conducted on IMI Kolkata’s official secured OLT platform, which is also used for institutional examinations.
  • Participants will receive problem statements and an integrated IDE within the platform.

What participants must do:

  • 2 to 3 coding questions/problems
  • Submit optimized solutions within the time limit.

Participants will write code using the provided IDE on OLT. Once submitted, the solutions will automatically be evaluated against 10 predefined test cases.
Scoring will be based on passed cases, and in the event of a tie, the participant with the earlier submission time will rank higher.

Duration:

  • Total duration of the round: 1 hour

Rules:

General Rules:

  • This is strictly an individual participation event.
  • Each participant must write and submit their own code.
  • Plagiarism, code-sharing, or seeking external assistance will result in disqualification.
  • Decision of judges and event coordinators will be final and binding.
  • Participants must report to the venue on time; delayed entries may not be allowed.

Round-Specific Rules:

  • Submissions after time expiry will not be evaluated.
  • Only one final submission per problem will be considered for evaluation.
  • Code must be executable and logically correct.
  • Partial scoring may apply based on test-case clearance.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Number of test cases passed
  • Correctness of output
  • Submission time (used as tie-breaker)
  • Logical clarity and structure of code
  • Time and space efficiency

All evaluations and scoring will be generated directly through the OLT platform, ensuring transparency and uniformity.

prizes.others: Winner receives a premium certification course worth ₹1,00,000 to enhance career and analytical skills.

data.title: Apertre 3.0
data.details:
Apertre 3.0 is a 30-day open-source contribution program by Resourcio Community, where students and developers collaborate, contribute to real-world projects, and grow their technical + community skills.

Participants can contribute to a wide range of repositories — web, app, ML, design, documentation, and more — under the guidance of mentors and project admins.

Guidelines

Eligibility

  • Open to all students and professionals across the world.
  • No prior open-source experience required.
  • Both individual and team contributions are allowed (team formation optional).
  • Inter-college and inter-specialization participation is allowed.
  • Minimum age requirement: 16+ years.

Format

The program runs for 30 days (1 Feb – 1 March).

It includes:

  • Project listing & selection
  • Mentor support and guidance
  • Task-based point system
  • Leaderboard tracking
  • Offline closing ceremony – ResCon 2.0

Process:

  1. Mentee Registration (from 7th December)
  2. Mentor & Project Registration
  3. Community Partner & Evangelist Registration
  4. Project Shortlisting & Reveal
  5. Apertre Starts – Contribution Window Opens
  6. Points + Leaderboard Updates
  7. Final Review & Evaluation
  8. Results Announcement on 3rd March
  9. Offline Event – ResCon 2.0 (22nd Feb)

Contribution Areas

Participants can contribute to:

  • Frontend / Backend / Full-stack Projects
  • Mobile App Development
  • DevOps / Cloud Projects
  • Design (UI/UX, branding, assets)
  • Documentation
  • Bug fixes / Feature additions
  • Sponsor-specific tasks

Event Deliverables

  • Projects live on GitHub
  • Mentors assigned to each repository
  • Tasks labeled Easy / Medium / Hard
  • Contribution guidelines provided for every repo

Rules

General Rules

  • Participants must use Git & GitHub for all contributions.
  • All PRs must follow the repository’s Contributing Guidelines.
  • Plagiarism or copying someone else’s work will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • PRs should be meaningful — spam PRs, irrelevant commits, or automated PRs will not count.
  • Participants must maintain professional communication with mentors and admins.

PR Evaluation Rules

  • PRs must be merged or approved by project admins/mentors to be counted.
  • Points will be assigned based on difficulty level:
  • Easy: 10 points
  • Medium: 20 points
  • Hard: 30 points
  • Documentation: 5 points
  • Bonus Tasks / Sponsor Tasks: variable
  • Extra points may be awarded for outstanding contributions.

Participation Rules

  • Maintain respectful behavior in Discord and event channels.
  • Follow deadlines strictly; late contributions may not be counted.
  • Participants who remain completely inactive for 10+ days may be removed.

Event Duration Rules

  • Contribution window: Feb 1 – Mar 1
  • Final results published after review: 3rd March

Round Details (for Unstop)

Round 1: Mentee Registration

  • Online registration
  • No screening required
  • Open to all

Round 2: Contribution Phase (Main Round)

  • Duration: 30 Days
  • Participants contribute to assigned or chosen projects
  • Continuous evaluation and point-based scoring

Round 3: Review & Result

  • Mentors review all PRs
  • Final leaderboard published
  • Winners announced on 3rd March

data.title: Dev Duel
data.details:
Dev Duel is an intensive development hackathon where participants collaborate to design, code, and deploy innovative solutions to real-world problems. It challenges technical proficiency, creativity, and teamwork under time constraints, fostering rapid prototyping and problem-solving skills. Participants showcase their coding expertise, UI/UX design, and project management abilities in a competitive environment.

Competition Structure:

Round 1: Online Round

  • Participants are required to submit their application’s source code in a GitHub repository (link).
  • The repository must be documented with a README, including instructions to configure the environment and run the application.
  • A short 3-5 minute video explaining their project must also be submitted (link).

Round 2: Grand Finale (Offline)

Final offline round on campus, upon selection through shortlisting online round to present their projects and showcase their work.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth ₹40,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals
  • Team size: 1–4 members
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules:

  • Teams will submit their final projects as GitHub repositories. The repository must include a README.md file with setup instructions.
  • Teams may optionally deploy their projects to earn bonus points.
  • All work must be original and created during the hackathon. Pre-existing projects will be disqualified.

data.title: Innov-AI-tion
data.details:
Ignite your skills at Innov-AI-tion, presented by Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad! Join this online challenge to collaborate on real-world problems and showcase your coding prowess. Don't miss your chance to innovate and make an impact!

Competition Structure:

Round 1: Online round

  • Participants are required to submit their application’s source code in a GitHub repository (link).
  • The repository must be documented with a README, including instructions to configure the environment and run the application.
  • A short 3-5 minute video which covers the merit, unique features, and selling-points of their product must also be submitted (link).

Round 2: Grand Finale(Offline)

  • Shortlisted teams will be having an offline round on campus (IIT Hyderabad).

Rewards & Benefits: 

  • Prizes worth ₹50,000.

Eligibility and Registration:

  • Open to all individuals.
  • Team size can be 1-4 members.

Rules & Regulations:

  • Participants can participate in teams of up to 4 members.
  • Code submitted will be subjected to a plagiarism check. Submissions found to contain plagiarized material will be disqualified.

Don't miss the chance to participate in Innov-AI-tion! Register now and be part of this exciting coding challenge presented by Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

data.title: Enigma CTF
data.details:
Enigma CTF, presented by Elan & nVision at IIT Hyderabad, is an online cybersecurity competition open to coders of all skill levels. Designed to test abilities through complex challenges, the event offers participants a platform to sharpen their skills, collaborate with teams, and compete for recognition in the coding domain.

Competition Structure:

  • The competition will be conducted online. It will be a 24 hour event, happening on 5th & 6th Jan 2026.
  • Flags must be submitted online on the specified competition site. 

Rewards & Benefits: 

  • Prizes worth ₹20,000.
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility and Registration:

  • Open to all individuals.
  • Maximum capacity of each team is 3.

Rules & Regulations:

  • Zero Tolerance on Attacks: Brute-forcing, DOS, or DDOS attacks on the server are strictly prohibited and will result in immediate disqualification.
  • No Collusion: Sharing flags or hints with competing teams is forbidden.
  • Flag Format: All flags must be submitted in the exact format: enigmaCTF26{…}.
  • Dynamic Scoring: Challenge point values decrease as more teams solve them.
  • No Negative Marking: There are no penalties for incorrect submissions.
  • Tie-Breaking Policy: In case of a tie, the team that solved their last question the earliest wins.
  • Open Resources: Participants are allowed to use the internet and external tools during the 24-hour event.
  • Organizer Discretion: Organizers reserve the right to make final decisions regarding any rule or dispute.

Don't miss the chance to participate in the Enigma CTF! Register now and prepare to showcase your coding skills in this exciting online challenge.

data.title: Game Jam
data.details:
Game Jam is a competitive event where participants design and develop innovative games from concept to prototype. It tests creativity, programming skills, design thinking, and storytelling. Contestants can work solo or in teams to build engaging, functional games that showcase technical expertise, gameplay mechanics, and user experience.

Competitions Structure:

Online Round:

  • Each team has to write a report describing their game. It should consist of:
  • Title of the game (it should be the same as the title you upload to Itch
  • Name of your team and the names of your team member
  • Concept and idea behind the game
  • Controls/instruction
  • Link to the game
  • List of themes used and in what ways were they incorporated into your game
  • List of software, assets, and resources used along with their sources (for example, links)
  • The game submission must be on itch.io
  • Each team has to take a small video of the gameplay of their game. 
  • Upload the report and the video to Google Drive and submit the shareable link (ensure access settings are set to "Anyone with the link")

Rewards and Benifits:

  • Prizes worth ₹20,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Open to students and professionals across India
  • Team size: 1–5 members
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules:

  • The game should be made within the stipulated time and be relevant to the theme
  • You are free to use any game engine, software, or library to create your game
  • You can also start with any base code that you already have
  • You can use assets that you previously created yourself.

data.title: Code-A-Thon 2.0
data.details:
Details:

  • CSI DMCE presents the second edition of its flagship hybrid hackathon, CODE-A-THON 2.0, an innovation-focused competition designed to foster creativity, technical excellence, and futuristic problem-solving.
  • This year’s theme, Hack The Space, inspires participants to push boundaries, explore emerging technologies, and develop impactful solutions to the official problem statements provided by the organising committee.
  • CODE-A-THON 2.0 follows a two-stage hybrid format, combining online evaluation with an intensive offline hackathon - enabling students to demonstrate their skills from ideation to execution.

Event Format:

Round 1: Online Screening (Idea Submission)

Participants must submit:

  • A structured PPT describing their proposed solution
  • A short video explaining the concept
  • The PPT Template is given in the website 
  • The Problem Statement are also given on the website

Submissions must align with the theme Hack The Space and must be based on the official problem statements provided by CSI DMCE.

Shortlisted teams will be invited to participate in the offline hackathon.

Round 2: Offline Hackathon (On Campus)

Time: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM (12 hours)
Venue: Datta Meghe College of Engineering (DMCE), Airoli

Shortlisted teams are required to start building their prototype from home. The offline round focuses on completing, refining, and presenting the final solution.

Teams must present:

  • A working prototype
  • Business model
  • Impact analysis
  • Target user segment
  • Technical feasibility and implementation details

Evaluation will consider innovation, usability, clarity, real-world relevance, and technical depth.

Important Eligibility Note:

The hackathon is recommended to students from the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR), including:

  • Mumbai
  • Navi Mumbai
  • Thane
  • Kalyan–Dombivli
  • Panvel
  • Karjat
  • Nearby reachable regions within MMR

Participants from Pune, Nashik or any outstation location beyond MMR should register but based on your decisions and consent letters will be taken by organisers, as the offline round requires same-day travel feasibility.

Eligibility:

  • Open to undergraduate and diploma students within the MMR region
  • Teams of 2 to 4 members
  • Students from any branch with basic technical knowledge
  • A valid student ID card is mandatory

Why Participate:

  • Solve expert-curated real-world problem statements
  • Build a portfolio-ready prototype
  • Interact with mentors, peers, and industry professionals
  • Gain recognition through awards and certificates
  • Experience a complete innovation lifecycle from idea to prototype to pitch

General Guidelines:

  • Shortlisted teams must attend the offline round in person.
  • Participants must bring laptops, chargers, and required project components.
  • Evaluation will be based on innovation, feasibility, technical complexity, impact, and presentation.
  • Submissions must include documentation, repository/demo links, and a concise PPT.
  • Lunch will be provided during the offline hackathon.
  • Organisers’ decisions will be final and binding.
  • Event timings may be adjusted based on operational requirements.
  • Refer to the official event page or contact organisers for detailed instructions.

Prize Pool: ₹25,000

Overall Hackathon Awards (Not PS-based):

  • First Prize: ₹12,000
  • Second Prize: ₹8,000
  • Third Prize: ₹5,000

All winning team members will receive medals and certificates.
Participation certificates will be awarded to all shortlisted teams for offline hackathon.

Organised By:

  • Computer Society of India (CSI) – DMCE Chapter
    Committed to promoting innovation, technical leadership, and collaborative learning through workshops, projects, and high-impact events.

Contact Person:

  • Farhaan Shaikh : +91 70211 77410
  • Aniket Salvi : +91 84080 50673

data.title: Zerve AI Hackathon
data.details:
Most analysis never leaves the notebook. The Zerve AI Hackathon challenges you to go further. Build an autonomous analytical system that doesn't just generate insights, but proves they work and deploys to production. Create a predictive or prescriptive workflow, validate its effectiveness, and ship it as a live API or scheduled job. No slides. No prototypes. Real systems that run.

Eligibility:

  • This hackathon is open to data professionals only - data scientists, data analysts, analytics engineers, ML engineers, and similar roles.

The Challenge:

Build a deployed, measurable analytical system in Zerve that:

  • Solves a real business problem: Churn prediction, demand forecasting, anomaly detection, recommendation engine, or your own use case
  • Includes a model or recommendation engine that makes predictions or recommendations
  • Proves it works: Include validation metrics (backtesting, holdout validation, accuracy metrics, business KPIs). Justify your approach.
  • Ships to production: Deploy as an API endpoint or scheduled workflow using Zerve's deployment features

You may use your own data or select from Zerve's example datasets (Titanic, Palmer Penguins, NASDAQ 100, Data Science Salaries, Hotel Reviews, and more).

Promo Code to avail 25 free Zerve credits: Hackathon-Unstop

Timeline:

  • Submission deadline: January 11th

Registration Process

  • Register on Unstop by clicking on the 'register' button.
  • Sign up for Zerve using the following link: https://bit.ly/4oCkygj

Submission Requirements:

Participants must:

  1. Click on the "Submit" button and submit:
    • Link to your Zerve canvas
    • Written report overview explaining what you built, the problem it solves, and your validation approach
  2. Post on LinkedIn OR X (Twitter) sharing what you built, with a link to your Zerve canvas. Tag @Zerve AI and @unstop on LinkedIn and @Zerve_AI on X.

Optional but strongly encouraged: Post a short video walkthrough (under 3 minutes) explaining your solution on LinkedIn or X, tagging @Zerve AI and @unstop or @Zerve_AI respectively. Video submissions will receive higher weighting in judging.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Individual participation only.
  • All work must be built within the Zerve platform
  • Submissions must include deployed functionality (API or scheduled job)
  • Submissions must include validation metrics demonstrating effectiveness
  • One submission per participant
  • Submissions must be original work created during the hackathon period
  • By submitting, you grant Zerve permission to share and feature your work

Judging Criteria:

Criteria Weighting
Model/Recommendation Effectiveness: Does it actually work? Show us the metrics. 40%
Business Relevance: Is this solving a real problem someone would pay for? 25%
Production Readiness: Deployed, scheduled, scalable, robust. 20%
Creativity: Novel approach, unexpected use case, clever application. 15%

Video submissions will receive additional consideration in the final judging.

Rewards and Prizes:

  • 1st Place - $2,000 USD + Zerve Credits
  • 2nd Place - $1,000 USD + Zerve Credits
  • 3rd Place - $500 USD + Zerve Credits
  • All participants will receive a certificate of participation.

prizes.others: The participant securing 1st Place in the Zerve AI Hackathon will be awarded $2,000 USD + Zerve Credits.
The participant securing 2nd Place in the Zerve AI Hackathon will be awarded $1,000 USD + Zerve Credits.
The participant securing 3rd Place in the Zerve AI Hackathon will be awarded $500 USD + Zerve Credits.

data.title: Mysti Code – Decode Debug
data.details:
MSystic Code is an online coding challenge designed to test the problem-solving skills, debugging ability, and logical thinking of students. This is not a simple coding contest — each problem contains intentionally placed mystery errors and twisted hint comments that participants must decode to identify and fix the logic.

The event consists of 5 interconnected coding tasks.

The twist?

The output of each corrected code becomes the input for the next code.

This chained-flow structure ensures contestants must think carefully, debug accurately, and maintain consistent logic throughout the entire challenge.

Whether you’re a beginner sharpening your debugging skills or an experienced coder looking for a unique challenge, MSystic Code offers an exciting opportunity to prove your mastery.

Event Structure:

  • The challenge contains 5 coding problems, each provided with
    •   A partially incorrect code snippet
    • Hidden bugs (logic errors, syntax errors, runtime traps)
    • Comments with indirect or twisted hints
  • Participants must:
    • Understand the intentionally flawed code
    • Identify & correct the mistakes
    • Produce the correct output
    • Use that output as input to the next problem

️Rules & Guidelines:

  • The event is conducted online via Unstop.
  • Participants must complete all 5 questions within the given time.
  • Each code will be evaluated based on:
    • Correctness of output
    • Successful debugging
    • Clean and efficient logic
  • The initial input for Problem 1 will be provided.
  • The output of Problem 1 → Input for Problem 2 → and so on.
  • No external code templates are allowed; participants must debug the provided code.
  • Plagiarism or discussing answers with others during the event is strictly prohibited.
  • Decisions of the organizing team will be final.
  • Participants can use any supported language available on Unstop (C,Java, Python).
  • Multiple submissions are allowed within the time limit.

Who Can Participate?

  • Open to all engineering students, irrespective of year or branch.
  • Individual participation only.

Rewards & Recognition:

  • First Prize: ₹2,000 Cash Reward
  • Runner-Up Prize: ₹1,000 Cash Reward
  • Certificates:
  • E-Certificates will be provided to all participants
  • Achievement Certificates for Top Performers

Event Date:

  • 7th January 2025
  • Mode: Online (Unstop Platform)

data.title: Quant Insider Market Making Challenge
data.details:
Market making is at the core of modern financial markets — it provides liquidity, narrows bid–ask spreads, and enables continuous price discovery. This competition simulates a live market-making environment using the Nubra Trading API (UAT environment). Participants will build, test, and run a Python-based strategy that reacts to real-time order-book data, makes dynamic quoting decisions, and tracks PnL and inventory performance.

Guidelines:

  • Technical Requirement: Participants will design and implement a Python-based market-making algorithm that connects to Nubra’s UAT environment.
  • API Usage: Participants will use Nubra’s Python SDK (v0.3.5) to access UAT market data feeds. Key APIs include Authentication, Get Instruments, Market Quotes, and Realtime Market Data WebSocket.
  • Deliverables: Submissions must include a Python notebook/script, CSV logs with quotes and PnL data, and visualization plots comparing adaptive vs baseline strategies.
  • Reports: Reports explaining logic and key findings are encouraged.

Rules:

  • Strategy Objective: The algorithm must quote bid and ask prices dynamically around mid-price, adapt to order-book imbalance and inventory, and simulate fills.
  • Risk Management: Participants must manage risk by keeping their net position (inventory) near zero. Cap inventory and log every event with timestamps.
  • Data Handling: Handle prices in paise and reconnect sockets gracefully.
  • Mechanics: Dynamic spread adjustment and skew control are core to profitability and risk management.

Timeline:

  • 15 December: Online Webinar for Onboarding (Link will be updated accordingly)
  • 23 December: Event Day

Evaluation Criteria: Judging will be based on a total of 100 points (plus bonus):

  • Profitability (40 pts): Effectiveness of the PnL generation.
  • Risk Control (20 pts): Ability to manage inventory and exposure.
  • Responsiveness (20 pts): Speed of reaction to market data.
  • Stability (10 pts): Robustness of the code.
  • Presentation Quality (10 pts): Clarity of logs and reports.
  • Bonus (10 pts): Awarded for creative visualization.

data.title: Project Morpheus
data.details:
Project Morpheus 2026: The Awakening, hosted by SIT Lonavala (STES), is here — a national-level awakening where code meets reality. Over 24 hours of intense building, brainstorming, and deployment, developers will break the simulation to solve real-world problems and showcase their innovation.

Key Details:

  • Registration & Round 1 (The Filter) Deadline: 28th January 2026

  • Final Onsite Round (The Construct): 26th – 28th February 2026

  • Venue: SIT Lonavala Campus & SKN Sinhgad Institute

  • Prize Pool: INR 2 Lakhs+

  • Theme: Real-World Impact Domains

Theme: Break the Simulation Participants must choose the "Red Pill" and solve critical challenges affecting millions. Instead of open innovation, teams must select one of five specific impact domains: EdTech, Healthcare, Women Safety, Agritech, or Fintech. The aim is to move beyond theory and build deployment-ready solutions.

Round 1 – The Filter (Idea Submission): Round 1 is currently live. As soon as you register, you can form your team and submit your vision via the presentation template. Both registration and submission close on 28th January 2026.

What to Submit:

  • Problem Statement: Select one of the defined problems (available at https://www.projectmorpheus.in/problem-statement).

  • Solution Approach: Describe your proposed architecture and the "Red Pill" solution.

  • Tech Stack: List the technologies (Web, AI/ML, Blockchain, IoT) you plan to use.

  • Impact: Highlight how your solution solves the specific "glitch" in the real world.

Evaluation Criteria for Round 1:

  • Innovation & Creativity (25%): How novel is the approach?

  • Problem Understanding: Does the team grasp the root cause?

  • Feasibility (15%): Can it be built within 24 hours?

  • Social Impact: Does it align with the mission to solve real problems?

Round 2 – The Code (Online Pitch): Those who passed The Filter now face the Council. This is a live Google Meet encounter where shortlisted teams pitch their solution in 10 minutes, followed by 3 minutes of rigorous questioning.

  • Dates: 1st – 7th February 2026

  • Format: Live Google Meet Pitch (Recorded)

  • What to Expect: Individual slots assigned by 31 January. The Council evaluates technical depth and clarity.

  • Outcome: Top 100 teams advance to The Construct.

Round 3 – The Construct (Final Onsite Round): Top shortlisted teams will be invited to SIT Lonavala for the grand 24-hour offline hackathon from 26th–28th February 2026. Teams will architect, code, and deploy their prototypes in a high-energy environment, presenting live to industry experts.

Engaging Activities:

  • Live mentorship from industry experts and founders

  • Networking with investors and accelerators

  • Incubation opportunities for top projects

  • Food, accommodation, and Matrix-themed swag

Conclusion: Project Morpheus 2026 serves as a launchpad for students to awaken to their potential. Don’t miss this opportunity to enter the construct and build the future!

Stay Connected

  • Website: www.projectmorpheus.in

  • Instagram: @projectmorpheus2026

  • Email: support@projectmorpheus.in

data.title: Central India Hackathon 3.0
data.details:
Central India Hackathon - Chapter 3 (CIH 3.0) is a 24-hour national-level innovation marathon organized by Suryodaya College of Engineering & Technology (SCET), Nagpur, under the Youth Tech Connect (YTC) initiative. This edition brings a strong focus on the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UN - SDGs), empowering young innovators to build scalable, sustainability-driven and impact-oriented solutions.

After the massive success of CIH 1.0 and CIH 2.0, this chapter returns bigger, sharper, and more challenge-driven, inviting developers, thinkers, and creators from across India to solve pressing global challenges aligned with SDG 3 and SDG 9.

Event Highlights

  • Date: 23 - 24 January 2026
  • Venue: Suryodaya College of Engineering & Technology (SCET), Nagpur, Maharashtra
  • Mode: Offline (Final Round at SCET Nagpur)
  • Duration: 24-Hour Hackathon
  • Registration Deadline: 23 December 2025
  • Team Size: 2 - 4 members
  • Process: Registration → Idea Submission → Shortlisting → 24-Hour Offline Finale
  • Certification: Certificates for all finalists
  • Perks: Goodies, swags, mentorship, networking, and incubation opportunities

Hackathon Theme Tracks (SDGs)

  • SDG 3: Good Health & Well-Being - Build solutions that enhance healthcare accessibility, diagnostics, mental health, emergency response, medical data analytics, assistive technologies, and wellness tools.
  • SDG 9: Industry, Innovation & Infrastructure - Create innovations around Industry 4.0, automation, smart manufacturing, sustainable infrastructure, digital solutions, supply chain tech, and socio-economic development.

Eligibility Criteria

  • Open to all students across India (UG, PG, diploma, etc.)
  • Team size of 2 - 4 members
  • Cross-college & interdisciplinary teams allowed
  • Passionate innovators, designers, and problem-solvers encouraged

Why Participate in CIH 3.0?

  • Work directly on global challenges aligned with UN SDGs
  • Get access to exclusive mentors, domain experts & startup founders
  • Hands-on exposure to Industry 4.0 tools and technologies
  • Chance to convert your innovation into a real-world startup
  • Build a strong project portfolio and gain national-level recognition
  • Experience an electrifying 24-hour offline hackathon environment

Hackathon Format

Round 1: Idea Submission

  • Participants must submit their innovative idea aligned with SDG 3 (Good Health & Well-Being) or SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation & Infrastructure). 
  • All submissions must be uploaded through Unstop in the form of a presentation.
  • A standard PPT template is provided in the brief/case and in the attachments section for uniform evaluation, and each team must compulsorily follow the given template.
  • Only original, non-plagiarized ideas will be accepted.

Round 2: Evaluation & Shortlisting

All submitted ideas will be reviewed by a panel of industry experts, academicians, and domain specialists.

Evaluations will be based on:

  • Innovation & creativity
  • Technical feasibility
  • SDG alignment
  • Potential real-world impact
  • Clarity & execution approach
  • The top 100 shortlisted teams will be selected for the 24-hour offline finale at SCET, Nagpur.

Round 3: Final Round Confirmation
Shortlisted teams must confirm their participation by paying a mandatory fee of ₹1000 per team within the given deadline.

This fee covers:

  • Accommodation for the event duration
  • Food arrangements for all team members
  • Upon successful payment, teams will receive an official confirmation and invitation to participate in the onsite 24-hour hackathon at Suryodaya College of Engineering & Technology, Nagpur.

Prize Pool Details

Each SDG track has been allocated a total prize pool of ₹50,000, and for both tracks (SDG 3 & SDG 9), the prize distribution is as follows:

1st Winner (Per Track)

  • ₹21,000 Cash Prize
  • ₹10,000 Worth Incubation Support

Runner-Up (Per Track)

  • ₹11,000 Cash Prize
  • ₹8,000 Worth Incubation Support

This ensures that both SDG tracks reward innovation, scalability, and real-world impact with strong financial and incubation support.

InnovateX – Business Innovation Challenge

InnovateX is a real-world tech-enabled problem-solving competition where teams analyze a problem statement, design an innovative solution, and present a structured, impactful business/technology proposal.

Guidelines:

Eligibility:

  • Open to all engineering undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Students from any specialization of Engineering (B.E./B.Tech) can participate.
  • Inter-college teams are not allowed.
  • Inter-specialization teams are allowed.
  • Cross-year teams are permitted.

Team Formation

  • Team size: 2 to 4 members.
  • One person cannot be part of more than one team.
  • All members must belong to recognized educational institutions.

Competition Format

Round 1: Problem-Based Solution Pitch

  • A real-life managerial/technological problem will be provided.
  • Teams must propose a tech-enabled solution supported by logic, feasibility, and innovation.
  • Submit a presentation (PPT) as per the guidelines provided.
  • Top teams shortlisted based on creativity, clarity, and practicality will qualify for Round 2.

Round 2: Dataset-Based Analytics & Decision-Making Round

  • Shortlisted teams will receive a dataset.
  • Teams must analyze the data using relevant analytical tools.
  • Participants will answer the provided questions and build insights demonstrating data-driven decision-making.
  • The final submission must include:
    • Analysis summary
    • Visualizations (if required)
    • Structured responses to the questions

Duration

  • Round 1: Preparation window will be mentioned in the problem document.
  • Round 2: Duration mentioned along with the dataset (typically 1–2 hours).

Problem Statements / Questions

  • Round 1 will have one real-world problem statement provided to all teams.
  • Round 2 will include multiple data-based questions tied to the dataset.
  • The complexity will be moderate to advanced.

Rules

General Rules

  • All submissions must be original. Plagiarized or AI-generated work without modification will lead to disqualification.
  • Decisions made by the judging panel will be final and binding.
  • Teams must adhere to the deadlines for both rounds.
  • Any attempt to influence judges or organizers will result in disqualification.
  • Maintain professional conduct during presentations and Q&A rounds.

Round-Specific Rules

Round 1

  • Only one PPT submission per team.
  • Maximum slide limit will be communicated in the problem statement.
  • The proposed solution must be feasible, ethical, and implementable.

Round 2

  • External assistance or collaboration with non-team members is strictly prohibited.
  • Teams must use only the dataset provided.
  • The use of Python, Excel, Power BI, or other analysis tools is allowed unless specified otherwise.
  • Answers must be backed by logical reasoning and data insights.

Judging Criteria:

  • Creativity & originality of idea
  • Practicality and implementability
  • Clarity of thought and presentation
  • Depth of analysis (Round 2)
  • Data-driven justification
  • Overall coherence of the solution

data.title: Arbitrage Arena
data.details:
Event Description:
 
Arbitrage Arena 2026 is a national-level quantitative finance competition where participants develop fully functional algorithmic trading models and portfolio optimization systems using real historical market data.
The competition tests participants on model design, risk management, and robustness under stress conditions such as flash crashes and volatility spikes.
 
Participants must choose one of two problem statements in the prelims and submit:
 
  • A Jupyter Notebook (.ipynb) containing the full model implementation
  • A Technical Report (.pptx) summarizing approach, logic, and performance
Top-performing teams qualify for the Final Hidden Challenge, where a new dataset and modeling problem are released. The finalists will have time until 31 January 2026 to submit their final notebook + report. Final results will be announced during Pravega 2026 (Feb 7–8).
 
What Participants Have to Do:
 
Step 1 — Choose ONE Problem Statement
Participants select either:
Problem 1: Surviving the Crypto Flash Crash:
Build a trading/risk model that survives flash crashes, minimizes drawdowns, and recovers quickly.
Problem 2: Cross-Asset Portfolio Optimization:
Construct a diversified systematic portfolio across equities, indices, and commodities with high Sharpe and low drawdowns.
 
Step 2 — Use ONLY the provided datasets
You will receive historical OHLCV data for:
  • Cryptocurrencies (BTC, ETH)
  • Equities (Tesla, Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, Nvidia, Meta)
  • NASDAQ Index
  • Commodities (Gold, Silver, Crude Oil)
  • Participants must load, clean, process, and analyze this data inside the notebook.
 
Step 3 — Build Your Model
 
Your model must include:
 
For Problem 1 (Crypto Flash Crash):
  • Volatility estimation
  • Crash detection logic
  • Position sizing / hedging strategy
  • Risk controls (stop-loss, exposure limits, drawdown limits)
  • Return analysis before, during, after crash
 
For Problem 2 (Cross-Asset Portfolio):
  • Return calculation
  • Risk estimation (covariance matrix, volatility, correlations)
  • Portfolio optimization logic (mean-variance, risk parity, regime switching, etc.)
  • Backtesting framework
  • Performance comparison across regimes
Step 4 — Submit Two Items
 
1. Jupyter Notebook (.ipynb)
Must contain complete code, explanation, outputs, and plots.
 
2. Technical Report (.pptx)
  • Max 12–15 slides summarizing:
  • Problem choice
  • Data processing
  • Model approach
  • Key formulas / logic
  • Backtest results
  • Metrics
REQUIRED NOTEBOOK FORMAT 
 
Your notebook must follow this structure:
 
1. Introduction
  • State the problem you selected
  • Outline your model idea
 
2. Data Import & Preprocessing
  • Load provided datasets
  • Handle missing values
  • Convert timestamps
  • Compute returns / log returns
  • Align multiple assets (if needed)
  • Include plots for:
  • OHLC
  • Return distributions
  • Volatility
 
3. Feature Engineering
Examples (participants choose relevant ones):
  • Moving averages, RSI, volatility
  • Correlation matrices
  • Crash indicators
  • Regime classification
 
4. Strategy / Model Design
Explain:
  • Algorithms used (with formula)
  • Risk management rules
  • Relevant constraints
 
5. Backtesting Framework
Must include:
  • Start & end dates
  • Position rules
  • Portfolio value calculation
  • Transaction cost assumption (default 0 unless implemented)
 
6. Evaluation Metrics (Mandatory)
 
For Problem 1 (Crypto Crash):
  • Crash Survivability Index (CSI)
  • Max Drawdown
  • Post-Crash Recovery Time
  • Sharpe Ratio
For Problem 2 (Portfolio):
  • Annualized Sharpe
  • Sortino
  • Max Drawdown
  • Volatility
  • Correlation Heatmap
  • Stress-test performance
 
7. Results & Plots
Must include:
  • Equity curve
  • Drawdown curve
  • KPI table
  • Rolling Sharpe
 
8. Conclusion
  • What worked
  • What failed
  • Possible improvements
 
EVALUATION & SCORING MATRIX:
 
Prelims Scoring (100 points total)
  • Component Weight
  • Model Logic & Innovation 25
  • Data Handling & Preprocessing 10
  • Risk Management 15
  • Backtesting Framework 20
  • Evaluation Metrics Quality 20
  • Clarity of Explanation (Notebook + PPT) 10
 
Top teams qualify for finals based purely on these scores.
 
Final Round Scoring (100 points total)
Based on the hidden problem:
  • Component Weight
  • Model robustness 30
  • Performance under stress scenarios 30
  • Risk-adjusted returns 20
  • Reliability & reproducibility 20
only your final submissions are judged.
 
IMPORTANT DATES:
  • Registration 5–21 Dec 2025
  • Prelims Submission 5–25 Dec 2025
  • Prelims Result Announced Early Jan 2026
  • Hidden Final Problem Released Early Jan 2026
  • Final Submission Deadline 31 Jan 2026
  • Winner Announcement 7–8 Feb 2026 (Pravega)
 
Rules:
  • Use only provided datasets
  • Submissions must be original
  • Notebook must run end-to-end
  • Late submissions are not evaluated
  • Judges’ decision is final

data.title: Agri-Tech Hackathon 2026
data.details:
About Agri-Tech Hackathon 2026:

Agri-Tech Hackathon 2026 is a national-level offline hackathon that brings together the brightest minds to innovate, collaborate, and develop technology-driven solutions for agriculture. Hosted by K. J. Somaiya School of Engineering (KJSSE), this event will be a 24-hour coding sprint where participants will work on challenges spanning precision agriculture, supply chain optimization, farmers’ empowerment, biofuel innovation, and open innovation in agriculture.

This is your chance to code, create, and revolutionize the agri-tech landscape with cutting-edge technologies like AI, IoT, blockchain, and data analytics. The hackathon will conclude with a pitching round where teams present their solutions to an esteemed panel of judges from industry and academia.

Eligibility & Team Formation:

  • Teams must consist of 3 to 5 members.
  • Participants must be undergraduate students from any discipline.
  • Teams can have members from different colleges.

Event Structure:

Round 1: Abstract Submission (Online)

  • Teams must submit a detailed abstract of their idea along with an Abstract (PDF) by January 05, 2026.
  • Submissions must follow the provided template.
  • Selected teams will be invited for the on-site hackathon at KJSSE, Mumbai.

Round 2: On-Site Hackathon (Offline at KJSSE, Mumbai)

  • Shortlisted teams must report to the venue on February 05, 2026.
  • Teams must build their project within the 24-hour hackathon duration (February 05-06, 2026).
  • Pre-existing projects are not allowed.
  • Food and snacks during the hackathon will be provided by the organizers.
  • A nominal fee of ₹200 per team is required after selection for Round 2.
  • Please note that the fee is applicable for the team who are shortlisted for Round 2.

Hackathon Tracks:

  • Theme 1: Next-Gen Agri-Tech

Tagline: Reinventing farming through intelligence and automation.
Focus: IoT, AI, Computer Vision, Autonomous Robotics, Drones, Predictive Analytics
What participants can expect:
Problem statements centered around next-generation farming technologies —
including multi-sensor crop monitors, autonomous rovers, solar-powered
drones, precision spraying systems, smart seed-sowing drones, AI disease
identification, and farm digital twins.

  • Theme 2: Agri-Market Access

Tagline: Connecting farms to markets with trust, transparency, and technology.
Focus: Post-harvest innovation, Smart storage, Quality grading, Blockchain, Demand
forecasting, Direct marketplaces
What participants can expect:
Challenges designed to improve the entire supply chain — such as smart cold
storage with spoilage sensors, automated grading machines, freshnesstracking packaging, blockchain-based traceability, AI-driven demand
prediction, and direct farmer-to-consumer platforms.

  • Theme 3: Farmer Empowerment

Tagline: Technology that puts knowledge and capability directly in the hands of
farmers.
Focus: Affordable tools, Offline solutions, Hyperlocal insights, Multilingual AI,
AR/VR training, Community platforms
What participants can expect:
Solutions that uplift farmers directly — including low-cost crop diagnostic
devices, compact weather stations, solar-powered information kiosks,
regional-language advisory chatbots, AR/VR learning modules, and
collaborative knowledge-sharing apps.

  • Theme 4: Green Growth

Tagline: Driving sustainable agriculture for a climate-resilient future.
Focus: Soil regeneration, Water conservation, Carbon monitoring, Climate
intelligence, Sustainable farming
What participants can expect:
Innovations targeting sustainability — such as IoT irrigation controllers, soil
health scanners, carbon capture monitoring devices, soil regeneration
dashboards, carbon-credit trading platforms, and AI water-usage prediction
systems. 

 

  • Theme 5: Open Innovation

Tagline: Innovate beyond boundaries — your problem, your solution.

Focus: Participant-driven ideas aligned with agriculture, sustainability, and emerging technologies
(AI, IoT, Robotics, Data Science, Blockchain, Climate-Tech, Rural Empowerment, Agri-FinTech, etc.)

What participants can expect:
This theme gives participants complete creative freedom to propose their own problem statements, as long as they align with the broader objectives of Agri-Tech Hackathon 2026. Teams can identify real-world agricultural challenges from their local communities, personal observations, or research insights.

Participants may submit innovations involving —

  • novel agri-tech hardware or software tools,

  • unique farmer-centric applications,

  • technology for rural value chains,

  • sustainable and climate-resilient ideas,

  • market linkage or financial inclusion concepts,

  • or any solution that advances modern agriculture.

Teams may also choose from the pre-existing problem statements provided on the official website if they prefer structured challenges.

 

Additional Information:

  • The decision of the organizing team will be final.
  • Teams cannot be changed or shuffled after registration.
  • AI/ML and emerging technologies are welcomed for implementation.

data.title: DRISHTI-NE Hackathon
data.details:
DRISHTI-NE Hackathon Overview: Leading the North East Digital Transformation

DRISHTI-NE Hackathon is the premier AI innovation challenge exclusively for the North Eastern Region, launched at the Regional AI Impact Conference in Shillong by the Hon’ble Chief Minister of Meghalaya. Designed as a strategic initiative under the IndiaAI Mission, the hackathon aims to position Meghalaya and the NER as national leaders in applied AI innovation.

Organised by IIM Shillong (Knowledge Partner) in collaboration with the Government of Meghalaya and MATH T-Hub, this hackathon seeks bold, practical and high-impact AI solutions that address real challenges unique to the North East, ranging from climate resilience and disaster management to language inclusion, rural healthcare, education, public service delivery, and more.

The program has been structured to mimic a full innovation lifecycle:
Ideate → Build → Validate → Pitch → Deploy.

Participants will go beyond theoretical proposals and develop functional AI prototypes aligned with the NER’s needs and the IndiaAI Mission’s 7 strategic focus areas.

What We Expect From Participants:

Participants are expected to:

  • Identify a genuine North-Eastern problem that AI can solve meaningfully.

  • Demonstrate why AI is necessary for the proposed solution.

  • Use responsible AI principles, including DPDP compliance, bias mitigation, and transparency.

  • Build a functional prototype/MVP, not just mockups.

  • Provide clear technical documentation, datasets, and architectural design.

  • Show feasibility: Could this solution realistically be piloted by a state department or community?

  • Showcase the potential social impact, inclusiveness, and scalability.

Hackathon Themes:

Participants must align their ideas with one or more of the following:

  • AI for Governance & Public Good

  • AI for Healthcare & Wellness

  • AI for Agriculture & Climate Resilience

  • AI for Education & FutureSkills

  • AI for Accessibility & Inclusion

  • Ethical & Responsible AI

  • Indigenous Generative AI

  • Open Innovation (Wildcard)

Eligibility:

Participants must be connected to any of the 8 NE states (Meghalaya, Assam, Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur, Mizoram, Nagaland, Tripura, Sikkim) through one of the following tracks:

Track A - Students

  • UG, PG, Diploma, and PhD students studying in any NER institution.

  • Students originally from NER but studying anywhere in India.

Track B - Professionals / Startups

  • Working professionals, freelancers, startups based in the NER.

  • Individuals originally from NER but working elsewhere in India.

Team Size:

  • 2 to 5 members per team. Interdisciplinary teams & Gender-diverse teams are encouraged.
