data.title: SHIELD 1.0 by BPR&D (CDTI), Jaipur
data.details:
SHIELD 1.0 is a high-intensity, security-driven 24-hour challenge hosted in Jaipur, bringing together developers, cybersecurity researchers, innovators, and problem-solvers to build advanced technological solutions that strengthen India’s internal security, intelligence capabilities, and law-enforcement efficiency.
Over one focused day, participants will collaborate to design and prototype impactful systems centered around surveillance intelligence, digital forensics, cybercrime prevention, public safety, and AI-enabled enforcement tools.

Enhanced Participant Experience:

  • Part of the prize allocation supports participant engagement through meals, working infrastructure, and necessary amenities.
  • Prizes are structured to reward innovation depth, real-world impact, and technical robustness.

Why This Event Matters:

  • SHIELD 1.0 goes beyond traditional hackathons by focusing on solutions that directly contribute to national security and public protection.
  • The event emphasises long-term impact, encouraging participants to build systems that can evolve into deployable tools for law-enforcement agencies.
  • Top teams may progress into extended collaboration or pilot opportunities with BPR&D and partner organisations.
  • The hackathon aims to initiate a long-term pipeline of innovation for smart policing, cyber intelligence, and public safety technology.

Who Should Attend:

  • Open to anyone passionate about building technology for security, intelligence, and law enforcement.
  • Ideal for students, beginners, and experienced developers interested in:
    • Surveillance systems
    • Cybersecurity
    • AI/ML for public safety
    • Digital forensics
    • Open-source intelligence (OSINT)
    • Crime analytics and secure systems

What to Expect:

  • A sustained, high-energy 24-hour development sprint.
  • Close guidance from senior mentors, practitioners, technologists, and officers working in security and enforcement domains.
  • Deep exploration of:
    • Drone & AI-based surveillance
    • Social media drug trafficking analysis
    • Identity verification systems
    • Data ingestion, indexing, and cross-agency analytics
  • Final prototype presentations to a panel of judges from BPR&D and partner institutions.

Cybersecurity Challenges & Tracks

  1. Drone & Facial Recognition for Live Crowd Surveillance
  2. Software Solutions to Identify Users Behind Social Media Drug Trafficking
  3. Real-Time Database for Delivery Personnel Verification (Gig Workers) & Banking Agents
  4. Tools for Data Ingestion, Indexing, Analytics & Inter-Agency Sharing (AI/ML)


Further Information:

  • Detailed schedules, rules, facilities, judging criteria, submission guidelines, and campus policies are available at https://shield.cdtijaipur.in/

data.title: K Hacks 3.0
data.details:
Overview:

K! Hacks 3.0 is a national-level hackathon organized by the CEG Tech Forum. It invites engineering students across the country to develop innovative, real-world solutions in domains such as Women Empowerment, EdTech, FinTech, Health Tech, Web3, Disaster Management, Environment & Sustainability, and Trust & Privacy.

The event consists of two rounds:

  • Round 1 – an online idea submission round
  • Round 2 – a 24-hour offline hackathon

Top-performing teams will receive exciting prizes and the opportunity to showcase their projects at Kurukshetra 2026. Participants will also gain valuable exposure, insights, and networking opportunities with industry experts and sponsors.

Tracks:

  • Women Empowerment
  • EdTech
  • FinTech
  • Health Tech
  • Web 3
  • Disaster Management
  • Environment & Sustainability
  • Trust & Privacy

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Participation is exclusively open to engineering students.
  • Idea submissions must follow the official Submission Template. (Download here)

Submission Rules:

Round 1 (Online):

  • Round 1 will be conducted completely online, with no participation fee.
  • Participants are required to submit their ideas for any problem statement relevant to the domains limited to Women Empowerment, EdTech, FinTech, Health Tech, Web 3, Disaster Management, Environment & Sustainability and Trust & Privacy on or before December 19th.
  • Submissions should strictly follow the template provided on Unstop or access it [here]. Any addition or modification to the given template is strictly prohibited.
  • The top 25 teams with the most compelling and domain-aligned ideas will be shortlisted.
  • Shortlisted teams will be announced between January 5th – 8th.
  • Results of Round 1 will be announced 15-20 days before Round 2 to ensure participants from different states can plan their journey ahead.
  • Evaluation of Round 1 will be done by multiple panels of sponsors and professors.
  • Selected teams must confirm participation within 2 days of the Round 1 result announcement.
  • Teams failing to confirm will not be considered for the finals.

Round 2 (Offline):

  • The 24-hour hackathon will be held offline on January 24th – 25th at Anna University, Chennai.
  • No registration fee is required for Round 2.
  • A fresh set of problem statements will be provided 7 days before the hackathon.
  • Teams must choose only from the official problem statements.
  • Participants should not bring existing projects from previous hackathons. If found without prior disclosure, the team will be disqualified.
  • Teams must bring their own laptops and required components.
  • Power supply and internet access will be provided.
  • Projects will be judged on innovation, implementation, impact, business value, feasibility, and presentation.
  • Jury decisions are final.

Team Rules:

  • Teams must consist of 2 to 4 members.
  • All members must be current engineering students in India.
  • Students from different engineering colleges may form a team.
  • Team changing or shuffling will not be encouraged.

 Travel and Accommodation:

  • Accommodation will be provided for the night of January 23rd, 2026.
  • Food and refreshments will be provided throughout the event.
  • Participants are expected to take care of their own travel costs.

Organizers' Decisions:

All decisions made by the organizers regarding team selection and problem statements are final. Participants may reach out to the organizers through the contact details provided.

Visit K! Hacks website for more details

About Prometeo:

  • Prometeo 2026 is the sixth edition of IIT Jodhpur’s National Technical & Entrepreneurial Festival.
  • Features a blend of competitions, workshops, and talks centered around emerging technologies.
  • Aims to promote collaboration, innovation, and impactful problem-solving.
  • Provides a platform for students to explore ideas, experiment with technology, and contribute to future advancements.

About Designathon:

  • A fast-paced 12-hour design sprint, one of Prometeo’s flagship creative events.
  • Participants create a complete end-to-end design solution within the given time.
  • The problem statement is revealed at the start of the event.
  • Encourages creativity under pressure, originality, and multidisciplinary thinking.

What Participants Must Create:

Logo Design:

  • A meaningful and theme-based logo representing the product or concept.

UI/UX Design:

  • Detailed app or website designs with polished mockups.
  • Must reflect user-centered thinking and aesthetic clarity.

3D Models (if required):

  • For visualizing product features or interaction elements.

Additional Assets:

  • Any extra components requested in the prompt or created to enhance the concept.

Eligibility:

  • Open to students from any institute across India.
  • Teams must consist of 3–5 members.
  • Cross-institute teams allowed.
  • A participant cannot be part of more than one team.

Submission Guidelines:

Presentation

  • A well-structured, professionally crafted presentation.
  • Must be uploaded to Behance and the Behance link included in the Drive folder.

Component Files (ZIP Folder)

  • All source files, design elements, and assets.
  • Files must be neatly organized, compressed, and consistent in format.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Creativity: Originality and innovative thinking.
  • Feasibility: Practicality and viability of the solution.
  • Clarity: How clearly the design communicates the concept.
  • Plagiarism Check: Strict scrutiny; copied work results in disqualification.

Rules & Ethics:

  • Plagiarism, outsourcing, cheating, or collusion is strictly banned.
  • Violations lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Judges’ decisions are final and binding.

data.title: Prompt Engineering
data.details:
Prometeo 2026, the national technical and entrepreneurial festival of IIT Jodhpur, brings to you the Prompt Engineering Challenge, a unique competition where creativity meets artificial intelligence. Inspired by Prometheus’s legacy of empowering humanity with knowledge and technology, this event continues the spirit of innovation by inviting participants to explore the growing world of AI-assisted design. In this challenge, participants will be provided with a blurred and grayscale reference image along with a theme. Using the power of prompt engineering and DreamStudio AI, teams must recreate the original image as accurately as possible while adding their own creative and thematic interpretation. The event tests precision, reasoning, prompt-craft, and artistic imagination, making it ideal for AI enthusiasts, designers, and innovators.

Guidelines:

  • Eligibility & Team Size: Participation is open to students across institutions. Teams must consist of 2–3 members as specified in the rulebook 
  • Mode of event & No. of rounds: Online event with a single round.
  • Inter-College / Inter-Specialization Teams: Both inter-college and inter-disciplinary teams are allowed, encouraging collaboration and diverse creativity.
  • Task Format: Each team will receive a blurred grayscale image along with a theme revealed on the event day. Using the AI provided by us, teams must attempt to recreate the image as closely as possible while showcasing a creative twist relevant to the assigned theme.
  • Round Duration: Teams will be given a fixed time window of 60 minutes to analyse the reference, build prompts, generate outputs, and upload the final submission. No extensions will be given.

Rules:

Submission Format:

  • All submissions must be uploaded through the Google Form/link provided on the day of event.
  • Accepted file formats: JPEG, JPG, PNG.
  • Prompt submission must include:
  • Positive prompts
  • Negative prompts
  • A brief explanation of the logic behind the prompt decisions.
  • File Naming Convention:
    Format: TeamName_PromptEngineering (e.g., TeamPhoenix_IITJodhpur) as mentioned in the rulebook.
  • Multiple generated images can also be submitted in a single ZIP file.

Evaluation Criteria: Judging will be based on the following parameters:

  • Image Accuracy: How closely the generated image matches the hidden reference.
  • Creativity & Innovation: Uniqueness and originality in interpreting the theme.
  • Prompt Engineering Quality: Clarity, effectiveness, and cleverness of prompt design.
  • Technical Execution: Proper utilization of DreamStudio AI features.
  • Explanation: Clear reasoning behind prompt structure and approach.

Prize Pool:

  • Exciting rewards worth ₹5,000 are up for grabs—recognizing the best prompt engineers of Prometeo 2026.

data.title: Code Wars
data.details:
Rulebook: Click here to open the rulebook

About Code Wars:

  • Flagship competitive programming event under Prometeo 2026, IIT Jodhpur’s National Technical & Entrepreneurial Festival.
  • Inspired by Prometheus—representing knowledge, innovation, and progress.
  • Designed as a high-intensity, Codeforces-style showdown testing:
  • Speed
  • Logic
  • Algorithmic thinking
  • Strategic time management

Event Overview:

  • Two-stage competitive programming contest: Online Round + Offline Round.
  • Follows official Codeforces rules and dynamic scoring.
  • Ensures fair competition with:
  • Transparent scoring
  • Limited access
  • Strict supervision
  • Problems require efficient algorithms, optimal coding, and precise execution.

Stage 1: Online Round

  • Conducted on official Codeforces platform.
  • Scoring uses dynamic decreasing score per problem.
  • Incorrect submissions result in penalty time.
  • Hacks disabled for this contest.
  • Number of problems and scoring distribution announced prior to the round.
  • Top 20 teams from the online leaderboard advance to the offline round.

Stage 2: Offline Round (On-Site at IIT Jodhpur)

General Structure:

  • Conducted under strict supervision.
  • Scoring remains identical to online round.
  • Contest includes:
  • Main Offline Round
  • Knockout Stage for Top 4 teams

Knockout Format:

  • Match 1: Rank 1 vs Rank 2
  • Match 2: Rank 3 vs Rank 4
  • Winners → Finals
  • Losers → 3rd Place Match

Additional Rules:

  • Problems shuffled randomly, not sorted by difficulty.
  • Each team can have up to 3 members.
  • Only one designated laptop allowed per team throughout offline stage.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • All team members must be from the same recognized college/institute.
  • Participants must have a verified Codeforces account with correct identity.
  • Only registered teams may participate—no substitutions allowed once the contest starts.

Rules & Restrictions:

Device Policy:

  • Only one laptop per team allowed.
  • No external devices or USB storage permitted.
  • Organizers may inspect devices anytime.

Prohibited Items:

  • Mobile phones, tablets, smartwatches.
  • Printed, handwritten, or digital notes.
  • Any external storage or connectivity device.

Internet & Tools Policy:

  • Internet access restricted to:
  • Codeforces contest page
  • Contest announcements
  • No external browsing, documentation, or forums allowed.
  • Use of AI tools (ChatGPT, Copilot, Gemini, etc.) strictly prohibited.
  • No online debugging platforms, code generation tools, or collaborative tools allowed.

  • Approach and model architecture
  • Data preprocessing techniques
  • Feature engineering (if any)
  • Evaluation strategy
  • Dataset insights
  • Why the solution is scalable & reliable

Note: Round 1 selection is based on both the PPT + Kaggle score.

Round 2: Prototype Presentation (On-Campus)

  • Shortlisted teams will present their prototype at IIT Madras.
  • Teams must showcase:
  • Working prototype or model pipeline
  • Key insights from Round 1
  • Improvements made after the Kaggle round
  • Deployment feasibility or business relevance

General Rules:

  • Register before the deadline — no late entries accepted.
  • All decisions by the organizing committee/judges are final.
  • Teams must strictly follow deadlines and file formats.
  • Any unethical practice (plagiarism, model leakage, submitting others' work) leads to immediate disqualification.
  • Use of GenAI tools for coding/explanations: allowed.

This program aims to empower founders and innovators solving real medical challenges with AI — from diagnostic precision to hospital workflow efficiency, from women’s health to NCD management.

data.title: Odoo x SNS Coimbatore Hiring Hackathon '26
data.details:
Register Here To confirm your Participation: https://hackathon.odoo.com/event/odoo-x-sns-coimbatore-hackathon-26-7/register

Welcome To The Odoo x SNS Coimbatore Hackathon '26:

  • Welcome to the Odoo x SNS Coimbatore Hackathon '26 - by SNS College of Technology (SNSCT), Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu!
  • A dynamic online coding challenge in the realm of Hackathons.

About Odoo Hackathon:

  • Odoo India's hackathons are open challenge to all tech enthusiasts and a great tool for Odoo to hire best coders and designers to join Odoo India's growing team.
  • Odoo India’s hiring hackathon journey began in June 2024 with Odoo Combat, our first open recruitment hackathon, attracting over 3,000 students and discovering exceptional young developers.
  • Encouraged by its success, Odoo India collaborated with leading universities to bring hackathons closer to emerging talent, transforming a simple idea into a nationwide hackathon series.
  • Today, Odoo India has replaced traditional campus placements with hiring hackathons.

About The Opportunity:

  • Join the Odoo x SNS Coimbatore Hackathon '26, presented by SNS College of Technology (SNSCT).
  • This online coding challenge invites teams to unleash their creativity and technical skills.
  • This is your chance to showcase your abilities in a dynamic online environment.
  • Collaborate with your team, develop innovative solutions, and make your mark in the world of Hackathons.

Open Challenge:

  • Virtual Round: 8-hour online hackathon
  • Final Round: 24-hour on-site hackathon for shortlisted teams
  • No participation fees
  • Teams of 1 to 4 members (Age: 18+), with cross-institution teams allowed
  • Problem statements are revealed only at the start hour to ensure fairness and creativity
  • Once you register for any Odoo hackathon, cannot apply again for next 3 months for other Odoo hackathons

Eligibility And Registration:

  • Open for all tech students, freshers, and coding enthusiasts (Age: 18+)
  • No prior experience required – just your passion for coding!
  • All programming languages are welcome!

Must Have:

  • Use real-time or dynamic data sources, and avoid relying on static JSON unless it’s for initial prototyping.
  • Create a responsive and clean UI (Consistent color scheme and layout).
  • Validate user input robustly.
  • Use intuitive navigation with proper menu placement and spacing.
  • Use version control (Git) properly; one member managing the repo is not enough.

Nice To Have:

  • Ability to design backend APIs, model data, and set up a local database.
  • Understand AI/code snippets thoroughly before using them; don't blindly copy-paste without adapting them to your project.
  • Plan for offline or local solutions and don’t rely entirely on internet connectivity or cloud-based tools.
  • Use trendy technologies only if they add real value to your project.

At Odoo, We Value Your Skills:

  • At Odoo, we value your skills, more than your resume.

What If You Win?:

  • Winning the hackathon and receiving a job offer are two separate outcomes.
  • You may win and still be ineligible for hiring based on criteria, and it’s equally possible to not rank in the top three teams yet get a call with employment opportunity.
  • At Odoo, we hire for talent, mindset, and determination and not just project completion.
  • We look for problem-solvers who think beyond the obvious and are ready to join the Purple Army.

data.title: Skill Climax V1.0 – Code the Future of Trust
data.details:
Welcome to Skill Climax V1.0—The Ultimate Code Battle by TECHhelp4U

Unleash your potential in a strategy-focused online coding challenge!

About the Opportunity:

Are you ready to architect the next big disruption? Welcome to Skill Climax V1.0, the flagship hybrid hackathon designed to bridge the gap between academic theory and industry innovation. Hosted by TECHhelp4U, a premier student-driven tech community, this event is a call to arms for India’s most promising developers, designers, and problem-solvers.

This isn't just a competition; it is a launchpad. We are creating an ecosystem where code meets culture, allowing you to compete with the best minds from across the country.

 

Why Should You Participate?

We have analyzed what students truly value. Here is what makes Skill Climax V1.0 unmissable:

  • Hybrid Flexibility: Participate in the Ideation Round from your campus/home. Only the best teams travel for the Grand Finale.

  • Career Acceleration: Top teams gain direct access to Pre-Placement Offers (PPIs) and internship interviews with our hiring partners.

  • The Offline Experience: The Grand Finale in Bhopal isn't just about coding—it's 36 hours of networking, mentorship sessions, food, and high-energy competition.

  • Community Recognition: Showcase your skills on a platform driven by students, for students.

 

Competition Structure

Round 1: The Blueprint (Online)

  • Format: Submission of a Project Proposal (PPT).

  • Goal: Pitch your idea, tech stack, and feasibility.

  • Selection: The most viable and innovative ideas will be shortlisted.

Round 2: The Grand Finale (Offline)

  • Venue: Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh.

  • Format: 36-Hour Non-Stop Hackathon.

  • Goal: Turn your PPT into a working prototype. Code, debug, and deploy in real time before a panel of judges.

Eligibility Criteria

  • Students Only: Open to all B.Tech/B.E., BCA, MCA, and B.Sc. (CS/IT) students.

  • Year: Open to students from all years (1st to 4th year).

  • Team Size: 2 to 4 members per team.

  • Inter-College Teams: Allowed and encouraged!

 

Code of Conduct:

  • Fresh Code Only: You cannot bring pre-written code. You may use open-source libraries and APIs, but the core logic must be written during the hackathon.

  • Plagiarism: Any team found copying code or ideas from other teams will be instantly disqualified.

  • Professionalism: Maintain decorum at the venue. Harassment or misconduct will lead to immediate expulsion.

 

Innovate. Build. Conquer. Registrations are closing soon. Secure your spot in the ultimate tech showdown.

Don't miss out on the chance to showcase your skills and make a difference. Register now for Skill Climax V1.0 and embark on an unforgettable journey of innovation and collaboration!

data.title: Hack The Winter - The Second Wave (Angry Bird Edition)
data.details:
Hack The Winter - The Second Wave (Angry Bird Edition) is a 24 hour national-level hackathon. Unlike other hackathons, we will not be limiting the problem sets to healthcare, sustainability, education, and smart automation.

 

We use wedded high quality questions for hackathons which are challenging but in a good way. These problem statements are important to showcase your skills for the actual hackathon. The problem statements will be given at the time of hackathon or pre-released a few days prior.

Teams are not restricted to a particular college, you can plan a reunion with all your friends from different colleges also.

Only shortlisted teams qualify for the on-site (physical) hackathon. Accommodation, local travel across campus (From Haldwani station - Bhimtal Campus) in fixed times, food, and technical arrangements will be provided. Food and technical arrangements are included in the hackathon fee; due to high demand for accommodation, a small accommodation fee may be requested for a priority pass otherwise common rest rooms are provided by default.

Themes & Problem statements (For Round1 + Round2): 

  • Web / App (Any idea with a Web / App interface)
  • Fintech 
  • AR / VR 
  • Governance (Build anything for the Govt)
  • Web3 / Blockchain 
  • AI / ML 
  • IoT & Automation
  • Open Innovation 

Problem statements for the final offine-round will be coming from NITI Ayog (Govt. Of India), which will be released a few days prior to the hackathon.

Eligibility & Guidelines:

  • Open to all college students (UG/PG) across India.
  • Participants can register in teams of 4 members.
  • Inter-college teams: Allowed.
  • Inter-specialization teams: Allowed, you can form team from different courses.
  • Each participant must have a valid student ID card and aadhaar card.
  • No change in team members post-registration.
  • A team can submit only one project idea.
  • Teams must bring their own laptops and peripherals for the on-site round.

Rules:

  • Internet usage is allowed for references, but plagiarism leads to disqualification.
  • All work must be original and completed during the hackathon timeframe.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  • Misconduct, inappropriate behavior, or rule violations will result in disqualification.
  • All shortlisted teams must attend the physical hackathon in person.
  • No judgement in UI/UX part, so rather than code we focus on concept, research and basic implementation.

Bird’s-eye Judging & Leaderboard:

  • To ensure fairness and transparency, project evaluations will take place every 6 - 10 hours throughout the hackathon.
  • Each team’s progress, creativity, and implementation will be continuously assessed and displayed live on the public leaderboard, allowing participants to track their standing in real time.
  • Final review by three specialized panels (industry + academia) for technology, innovation, feasibility / impact (holistic score).

Nests & Piggy Bank (Logistics):

  • Online Qualifiers: Accessible anywhere with an internet connection.
  • Offline Final Round: To be conducted at Graphic Era Hill University, Bhimtal Campus.

Find my team: https://chat.whatsapp.com/KHEb5s37poCCVVW5xrIobV

data.title: Quantified Dilemma
data.details:
About:

Quantified Dilemma is a unique blend of game theory, decision science, and human psychology presented through a series of strategic and analytical games. Participants will navigate challenges ranging from auctions and negotiation scenarios to dynamic optimization and uncertainty-based decision-making tasks. The event tests not only mathematical reasoning and coding ability but also intuition, adaptability, and strategic thinking under pressure.

The competition unfolds in two stages:

Round 1,2,3 – Prelims (Online):

  • Format: Submission-based round hosted on Unstop.
  • Description: Participants solve a set of strategy-driven and quantitative problems designed to simulate real-world decision environments. Analytical precision and reasoning depth are key.
  • Date: To be announced (tentatively mid-December 2025).

Finals (Offline):

  • Format: On-site interactive event conducted at IIT Madras.
  • Description: Shortlisted participants face live strategic scenarios — including negotiation simulations, team-based market challenges, and decision puzzles — that blend logic, psychology, and competitive gameplay.
  • Date: To be held during Shaastra 2026 at IIT Madras (early January 2026).

The event features both individual and team rounds, encouraging participants to showcase their analytical depth as well as their collaborative and strategic coordination.

data.title: E-Contest
data.details:
E-Contest: Unleash Your Coding Creativity!

Ready to embark on a coding adventure unlike any other? Dive into the E-Contest, where conventional coding takes a backseat and you’re invited to explore the fascinating world of esoteric programming languages! These quirky, unconventional languages challenge your logical skills and reward innovative thinking. Here’s your chance to think outside the box, tackle unusual coding problems, and compete for some fantastic prizes!

Why Join:

This isn’t your usual coding contest. In the E-Contest, you’ll test the limits of your programming knowledge, enhance your problem-solving abilities, and become familiar with languages you’ve probably never seen before. It’s the perfect opportunity to stand out, sharpen your skills, and win awesome rewards!

Event Format:

  • Individual Event: Each participant competes solo, ensuring a fair and focused experience for everyone.
  • Two Rounds: The contest consists of online prelims and finals at IIT Madras during Shaastra.

How It Works:

  • Esoteric Language Introduction: At the start of the contest, you’ll be introduced to an esoteric programming language along with essential guidance on how to use it. Don’t worry if you’ve never seen it before; a quick introduction will get you up to speed.
  • Challenge Set: A set of questions will be provided, each requiring creative solutions coded in the assigned language. The questions are designed to test your problem-solving skills and ability to adapt to unusual coding syntax and concepts.
  • Scoring:
    • Points will be awarded for each correctly solved problem.
    • The maximum points and fastest solutions will determine the winner, so accuracy and speed are both crucial.

Winner Selection:

  • The individual with the highest score and the least time taken to solve all problems will be declared the winner.
  • In case of ties or discrepancies, decisions made by the event coordinators will be final.

Important Notes:

  • The link for the event will be shared soon on Unstop.
  • Regular Updates: Stay tuned to our website for ongoing updates and information.
  • Queries & Support: Join our official communication channels to ask questions and receive prompt responses from event coordinators.

Are you ready to take on the challenge and dive into the world of esoteric programming? Test your creativity, showcase your skills, and make your mark!

Join now and prepare for the ultimate coding adventure!

Introduction:

Cybros proudly presents its flagship individual coding competition, a Division 2-style contest tailored to challenge and motivate participants. This two-hour event invites skilled coders to compete solo, showcasing their problem-solving abilities and technical expertise.

With an impressive prize pool at stake, the contest promises an engaging and high-stakes experience. Participants will have the opportunity to test their skills, push their boundaries, and achieve excellence in a competitive yet inspiring environment.

Join us for this remarkable event and seize the chance to prove your mettle. Let the spirit of coding excellence prevail as the best coder rises to the top!

Guidelines;

  • The contest will run for 2 hours and feature 6 problems to solve.
  • Participation is individual; team entries are not allowed.
  • A 10-minute penalty will be added for every incorrect submission.

Introduction:

Have you ever wondered what it feels like to participate in the renowned onsite ICPC contest? If not, Cybros is here to bring that exhilarating experience to you! Presenting an ICPC-style programming contest, this high-energy event challenges teams of three to engage in a rigorous five-hour problem-solving battle.

Put your coding expertise, teamwork, and strategic thinking to the test as you tackle a series of demanding problems designed to push your abilities to their limits. This is more than just a contest—it’s an opportunity to experience the thrill, intensity, and collaboration that define the ICPC spirit.

Join us for a memorable journey where strategy leads to success, collaboration drives innovation, and your skills take center stage. Get ready to compete, conquer, and showcase your potential in this ultimate test of technical excellence!

data.title: Escape Da Vinci
data.details:
EDV26 – ESCAPE DA-VINCI is a one-of-a-kind gamified vibe coding hackathon combining coding, puzzles, and creativity. Participants step into an escape room–style adventure, where they must unlock codes, debug problems, and build prototypes to progress through each stage.
The journey culminates in the Final Trophy Unlock, where only the sharpest minds triumph.

Event Overview

  • Beginner-friendly yet challenging for experienced participants
  • Fusion of coding, design, puzzles, and prototyping
  • Escape Room Format: Teams will be locked inside themed rooms; each round begins with a coded lock/problem. Solving it unlocks the challenge and grants access to the next stage
  • Online eliminations + 36-hour Offline Finale

Event Flow:

Online Rounds (5th November 2025 - 5th January 2026)

  • Round 1 – PPT / Video Submission
    • Submission: 8-slide PPT or 3–5 min video (template provided)
    • Tracks: AI/ML, Web/App, Robotics, Art/Design, Cryptography(submit any best project of yours on any problem statements following the given tracks).
    • Platform: Unstop
    • Outcome: Shortlisted teams qualify for Online Round 2
  • Round 2 – Website / Model Deployment
    • Task: Deploy a working project/model online
    • Platform: Unstop
    • Outcome: Top teams qualify for the Offline Hackathon

Offline Hackathon (21st –22nd January 2026 | 36 Hours)

The offline adventure follows a Da Vinci escape-room inspired format. Teams will be locked in rooms and must unlock challenges stage by stage:

  • Round 1 (3 hrs): Debug spectogram/code → unlock problem
  • Round 2 (3 hrs): Rapid prototype (AI/Tech-based)
  • Round 3 (2 hrs): Fun + Brainy Challenges (Puzzle / AR / Meme-based)
  • Round 4 (4 hrs): Final Spectogram & Trophy Unlock

Prize Pool:

  • 1st Place: ₹75,000
  • 2nd Place: ₹35,000
  • 3rd Place: ₹20,000
  • Special Awards:
    • Best UI/UX – ₹5,000
    • Most Fun Project – ₹5,000
    • Top Newcomer/First-Year Team – ₹5,000

Grand Prize: 2-ft Trophy + Prize Money

Guidelines

  • Eligibility
    • Open to all students across disciplines and years.
    • Teams of 3–5 members only.
  • Participation Rules
    • Teams must participate in both online rounds to qualify for the offline finale.
    • A minimal confirmation fee will be charged after round 1 to confirm your availability.
    • The offline hackathon will be conducted in escape-room style, where participants will be locked inside themed rooms and must solve challenges to progress.
  • Submission Guidelines
    • Online Round 1: Submit PPT (8 slides) or video (3–5 minutes) in the provided template (submit any best project of yours on any problem statements following the given tracks).
    • Online Round 2: Working website/model deployment with accessible link.
  • Hackathon Conduct
    • You are free to use any AI tool or platform!
    • Respectful conduct with peers, mentors, and organizers is mandatory.
  • Resources
    • Participants must bring their own laptops, chargers, and essential gear.
    • Internet access will be provided during the offline rounds.
    • Additional hardware/tools (if required for prototypes) should be managed by the teams themselves.
  • Finale Guidelines
    • Once locked inside the escape-room challenge, teams must rely on teamwork, skill, and creativity to progress.
    • The Final Round has no shortcuts – only problem-solving and collaboration will lead to the Trophy Unlock.

Why Participate:

  • Experience a real escape-room–themed hackathon
  • Blend of tech, puzzles, and adventure
  • Beginner-friendly yet competitive for pros
  • Build, innovate, and test your problem-solving skills under pressure
  • Win recognition, cash prizes worth ₹1.45 Lakh, and the Da Vinci Trophy

Registration Details

  • Platform: Unstop
  • Team Size: 3–5 members
  • Eligibility: Open to all students
  • Whatsapp group Link: https://chat.whatsapp.com/Dc4EPMI70gUJwgQxrIa3aE

data.title: Codesta Code Battle – Trial/Practice
data.details:
Codesta Coding Club proudly presents an exclusive trial coding contest crafted to help members sharpen their programming and analytical thinking. The contest is a perfect opportunity to experience the excitement of competitive coding, where participants must solve algorithmic challenges under time pressure while maintaining accuracy and efficiency. It is not just about solving problems, but about writing clean, optimized, and logical code.

Contest Format

  • Languages Allowed: C, C++, Java, Python
  • Sections:
    • Sec A: 4 Questions (5 marks each)
    • Sec B: 1 Questions (10 marks each)
  • Scoring is based on the number of test cases passed.
  • Multiple submissions are allowed, but only your best attempt will be counted.
  • In case of a tie, the ranking will be decided by the time of last correct submission.

Rules & Guidelines

  • Reporting Time: Flexible – test link remains open til 31st Dec 2025 (23:59). Participants can attempt the contest for 2 hour at any time within this window.
  • Registration is mandatory before the contest begins.
  • No smartphones, smart bands, or smart watches are permitted during the contest.
  • Copy-pasting code is strictly prohibited; participants must write their own solutions.
  • If a participant switches screens more than 3 times, the contest will automatically end.
  • Any cheating, plagiarism, or violation of rules will lead to immediate disqualification and a ban from future Codesta contests.

Note

This contest is purely for practice, learning, and self-improvement. There will be no prizes for ranks, but it is a golden opportunity to test your knowledge, challenge yourself, and gain the real experience of a competitive coding environment.
